title: Is it ever a good idea to get both Morellomicon and Athene (or Mikael's Crucible)?
body:
40% CDR along with never running out of mana and destroying healing and magic damage champs sounds really nice, I hate to choose one over the other.

Why is getting both a bad idea?

Is getting Mikael on mid ever a good idea if you're up against CC heavy champs?

And one more question: Does the sorcery and intelligence masteries increase your total CDR by a percentage of a percentage (i.e. 30% CDR + max ranks in either = 30.15% CDR, or is it 35% CDR?)

replies.body:
cdr stacks additively. otherwise 40% would be incredibly difficult to obtain

the only reason pros get morello over athenes (in mid lane) is because they ALWAYS get blue buff and they have a greater understanding of the matchup and how they should play so they take less damage, ideally. it gives more AP as well as being cheaper so they can get more important items so they can obtain mid/late game power spikes earlier

everywhere else, if you're not sure you're getting blue buff in mid lane, just assume you arent and get athenes for good mana sustain and i personally get roa quite frequently as it will solve my mana problems for the rest of the game, on most champions (that dont require tear). ideally for norms/solo-queue you should get athenes and then your NLR items. athenes with the 25 MR is...so so so much more valuable outside of professional play for mages, and the extra 300 or whatever gold is really worth it to keep you a lot safer as well as usually not running out of mana when you need it

i saw you played mainly xerath in your match history. i think with his passive athenes should be enough of an item for mana regen. mainly i just think xerath is such a long range threat landing a long range Q should be a big deal so you should go with your NLR items as fast as you can. of course asking for blue every game (but still expecting not to get it) would go a long way

I know when to take morello and when to take athene (it's really not as simple as pro vs non pro), but what about stacking both for 40%?

And I know CDR stacks additively, but masteries just love being pains in the backside to calculate by being the only exceptions to stats.

Also, is there a way to check my champion's CDR in game?

yeah just click on your champions portrait in game and it will give you a bunch of other stats

cdr mastery stacks additively too, anything that stacks multiplicatively isnt worth doing the maths on (masteries), more so than to just decide whether you need it over other available options

i agree with level1pentakill, not worth it to take just more mana items over stronger  combat stats. again with xerath hes just such a big threat with better ap items

another thing to add about morello+athenes build is, essentially, the cdr will kind of become a waste when you run out of mana and your spells are available but you have no mana to cast. the morello mana regen is certainly not enough to account for that, especially for a xerath

when you get the 5 or 3.75% cdr in masteries along with the 20% from athenes, it really should be enough. when you start building higher ap items you'll be able to take off more damage when you land 1 Q out of 1, over 1 Q out of 2 (in a specific timeframe based on just having the spell available on more cdr)
I very rarely ever have problems with mana when running morello...? Idk maybe I'm just too conservative with my spells even if I try to spam as much as possible.

Sorcery gives u 5% and intelligence gives you 2, 3, 5% so 10 all up, if u buy a stinger that's 20% CDR total. It just adds together.

Mikaels is expensive and you cant use it while you're CC'd if it's a hard CC and for that gold you could have a significant increase to your damage with AP.

It's not terrible to get both but really in most cases you benefit more from having an athenes and then heavy AP or maybe rod of ages or something or otherwise a morellos and then heavy AP. Spending a lot of gold for heaps of mana is rarely good because most fights end within about 10 seconds - far quicker than you could utilize that amount of mana regen usefully and you're missing out on a lot of damage. I prefer to rush an AP heavy item or morellos in some rare cases or athenes if im a spammer like Lux who is relatively squishy and can sit back and poke lots and is good with CDR (has sorta long cooldowns) and find the mana regen increase of athenes is better than morellos for her but its really situational, I just think heavy AP is better and these mana items are good as a 1st or 2nd buy or can even be skipped for just raw AP heavy builds and building two of them sets back your damage or defense too much.

Tear is a good buy vs AD mids for some spammers and Chalice is good vs AP mids as a spammer but I usually try to rush Needless and build heavy AP then consider buying one of the two, or rush one of the two (morellos or athenes) and then work on heavy AP to increase my damage.
